p: In the intensely managed Mar Menor catchment, the socio-economic scenarios determine the direction of changes, while climate seems not to have a significant influence on the hydrological regime. However, the impacts of a decrease in irrigated area that is assumed for three of the socio-economic scenarios can be indirectly related to climate change, or more specifically to a decrease of water availability in the donor basin of the Tagus-Segura IBWT (Kilsby et al. 2007; Lobanova et al. 2016; Morote et al. 2017).
